skill.name: seo-geo
skill.description:
SEO & GEO (Generative Engine Optimization) for websites.
Analyze keywords, generate schema markup, optimize for AI search engines
(ChatGPT, Perplexity, Gemini, Copilot, Claude) and traditional search (Google, Bing).
Use when user wants to improve search visibility.
skill.summary: Comprehensive SEO and Generative Engine Optimization tool. Optimize websites for both traditional search engines and AI chatbots like ChatGPT, Perplexity, and Claude.
skill.author: resciencelab

security_audit.summary: Legitimate SEO optimization skill with no security concerns. All static findings are false positives. The external_commands detections are documentation code blocks in markdown files, not executable shell commands. Network access is for SEO API calls to legitimate services. Environment variable access is for standard API credential management. No prompt injection attempts detected. Skill intent is clearly documented as SEO/GEO optimization.

risk_factor_evidence.confidence_reasoning: Backtick syntax in markdown files represents documentation examples, not executable code. The bash/python commands shown are illustrative examples for users to run, not actual shell execution by the skill.
Network access is for legitimate SEO API calls. The API_BASE URL is a legitimate DataForSEO endpoint for keyword research and SERP analysis. Documentation URLs are static reference links.
Filesystem access references in documentation describe file operations for reading SEO reports and schema templates. No destructive or unauthorized file operations detected.

Standard API credential management pattern. Reads DATAFORSEO_LOGIN and DATAFORSEO_PASSWORD from environment variables. No hardcoded credentials present. This is the recommended secure approach for API authentication.

content.user_title: Improve Search Visibility with SEO and GEO
content.value_statement: Websites struggle to be discovered by both traditional search engines and AI chatbots. This skill provides comprehensive tools for SEO optimization, schema markup generation, and Generative Engine Optimization to maximize visibility across all search platforms.
actual_capabilities: Analyze websites for technical SEO issues including meta tags, schema markup, and robots.txt configuration
Generate JSON-LD schema markup for FAQ pages, products, organizations, and web pages
Apply Princeton GEO research methods to improve citation rates in AI search engines
Research keywords using WebSearch and DataForSEO API integration
Validate schema markup using Google Rich Results and Schema.org validators
Optimize content for both traditional search (Google, Bing) and AI search (ChatGPT, Perplexity, Claude)
limitations: Requires external API credentials for advanced keyword research features (DataForSEO)
Does not directly modify website files; generates recommendations and templates for manual implementation
Cannot guarantee specific search rankings or AI citation outcomes
Performance depends on the quality of input URL and target website accessibility

use_cases.title: Website SEO Audit
use_cases.description: Run a comprehensive technical audit of any website to identify meta tag issues, missing schema markup, robots.txt problems, and sitemap availability.
use_cases.target_user: Website owners and developers wanting to diagnose SEO issues

use_cases.title: AI Search Optimization
use_cases.description: Apply GEO (Generative Engine Optimization) techniques to increase the likelihood of content being cited by AI systems like ChatGPT, Perplexity, and Claude.
use_cases.target_user: Content creators and marketers targeting AI-powered search

use_cases.title: Schema Markup Generation
use_cases.description: Generate properly formatted JSON-LD schema templates for FAQ pages, products, organizations, and articles to improve rich result eligibility.
use_cases.target_user: SEO specialists and web developers implementing structured data

prompt_templates.title: Basic SEO Audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze {url} for technical SEO issues. Check the title tag, meta description, H1 heading, Open Graph tags, and JSON-LD schema markup. Also verify robots.txt and sitemap.xml availability.
prompt_templates.scenario: When a user provides a URL and wants a quick SEO health check

prompt_templates.title: Keyword Research
prompt_templates.prompt: Research keywords related to "{topic}" for our website. Find search volume indicators, keyword difficulty, and competitor ranking opportunities. Use WebSearch to find recent data.
prompt_templates.scenario: When a user needs keyword targeting recommendations

prompt_templates.title: GEO Optimization
prompt_templates.prompt: Apply Generative Engine Optimization to our content about "{topic}". Use the 9 Princeton GEO methods: cite sources, add statistics, include quotations, use authoritative tone, simplify concepts, add technical terms, increase vocabulary diversity, and optimize fluency. Generate an FAQPage schema template.
prompt_templates.scenario: When a user wants to optimize content for AI search citation

prompt_templates.title: Complete SEO Strategy
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a comprehensive SEO optimization plan for our website at {url}. Include: (1) Technical audit findings, (2) Keyword research for {target_keyword}, (3) GEO optimization recommendations, (4) Meta tag templates, (5) JSON-LD schema suggestions. Reference platform-specific factors for Google AI Overview, ChatGPT, Perplexity, and Claude.
prompt_templates.scenario: When a user wants a full SEO strategy document

output: - Add Open Graph tags for social sharing
- Implement FAQPage schema for AI visibility

output_examples.input: Generate FAQPage schema for product FAQs

best_practices: Start with a technical audit to identify baseline issues before applying optimizations
Combine traditional SEO techniques (meta tags, schema) with GEO methods (citations, statistics) for maximum visibility
Validate all generated schema markup using Google's Rich Results Test before deployment
anti_patterns: Avoid keyword stuffing in meta tags or content; AI search engines penalize this
Do not block AI bots (GPTBot, ClaudeBot, PerplexityBot) in robots.txt when targeting AI search
Avoid generic or thin content without citations and statistics when optimizing for GEO

faq.question: What is the difference between SEO and GEO?
faq.answer: SEO (Search Engine Optimization) focuses on ranking in traditional search engines like Google and Bing. GEO (Generative Engine Optimization) optimizes content for AI systems like ChatGPT, Perplexity, and Claude. AI search engines cite sources rather than rank pages, so GEO emphasizes being a credible, citable source.

faq.question: Does this skill modify my website files?
faq.answer: No, this skill generates recommendations, templates, and audit reports. You must manually implement changes to your website. The skill provides JSON-LD schema snippets and meta tag templates that you copy into your site.

faq.question: What API credentials are needed?
faq.answer: The basic SEO audit and GEO methods work without API credentials. For advanced keyword research features using DataForSEO API, set DATAFORSEO_LOGIN and DATAFORSEO_PASSWORD environment variables.

faq.question: Which AI search engines does this skill optimize for?
faq.answer: The skill optimizes for ChatGPT, Perplexity, Gemini, Copilot, and Claude. Each platform has specific recommendations for robots.txt, schema markup, and content structure.

faq.question: What is the most effective GEO technique?
faq.answer: According to Princeton research, the most effective combination is Fluency + Statistics, which provides a maximum visibility boost. Adding authoritative citations (40% boost) and specific statistics (37% boost) significantly increases AI citation rates.

faq.question: How does schema markup help with AI search?
faq.answer: Structured data (JSON-LD) helps AI systems understand content context and relationship. FAQPage schema in particular shows high citation rates. Schema markup also enables rich results in traditional search while signaling content quality to AI systems.
